meanings.definition: Resembling a breast or nipple in shape or form.
meanings.sent1: The cake had a mamillary shape, looking like a small breast.
meanings.sent2: The rounded hill had a mamillary appearance, similar to a nipple.
meanings.sent3: The clouds formed a mamillary pattern in the sky, resembling tiny breasts.
meanings.sent4: The bumpy texture of the fabric felt mamillary under her fingertips.
meanings.sent5: The mamillary design on the vase made it stand out among the smooth ones.

meanings.definition: Relating to the mamillary body in the brain.
meanings.sent1: The doctor studied the mamillary brain region for research purposes.
meanings.sent2: The mamillary brain structure plays a crucial role in memory formation.
meanings.sent3: The mamillary brain area seemed to have its own little world inside.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts swirled like a storm in the mamillary part of her brain.
meanings.sent5: The mamillary neurons fired rapidly, signaling a memory recall.

meanings.definition: Having small rounded projections or bumps.
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar had a mamillary body, covered in tiny bumps.
meanings.sent2: The mamillary surface of the fruit felt rough to the touch.
meanings.sent3: The mamillary texture of the carpet made it cozy to walk on.
meanings.sent4: The mamillary bumps on the road caused the car to jolt.
meanings.sent5: Her skin felt mamillary after being in the cold wind for too long.
